data.title: Athletics: Rowlett High School
data.text:
Coaches

Stacy Henderson

Follow on Twitter @gisdnatatorium

What

Garland ISD offers competitive swimming and diving for both girls and boys at the varsity and junior varsity level at every high school. Swimming and Diving allows students to progress and earn their success on their own level by hard work, commitment and team accountability. Students should be enrolled into the swimming or diving class.

Where

All teams practice and compete at the new Garland ISD Natatorium. The address is 2585 Firewheel Pkwy, Garland TX 75040. Members of the team are involved in many other school organizations and activities and are very successful in the classroom. We consistently place swimmers on the All-District and All-Region Teams as well as Academic All-State.

When

Try outs are tentatively set for July 23rd and July 24th. In order to try out, all Athletic paperwork must be completed through Rank One. We will offer practices this summer for new and returning students, Monday through Thursday from 8 am to 10 am. Placement in class does not automatically place a student on Varsity or Junior Varsity. Placement on specific teams are at the discretion of the coaching staff. Varsity practice times are 6 to 8 am. Junior Varsity practice times are 1:45 to 3:30 pm.

Complete on-line paperwork

Info

Students should know how to swim, be knowledgeable of the four competitive strokes of swimming and able to swim a 50-yard freestyle at minimum.

In addition, other events that may be swum during try outs are the 50-yard breaststroke, 50-yard butterfly, 100-yard freestyle, 100-yard I.M. and the 200-yard freestyle. A test set may also be used to determine placement of swimmer during try outs.

For any questions please contact Coach Henderson or see your counselor.

Follow RHS Volleyball on Twitter at @RHS_EagleVBall

Tryouts and summer info

Providing a highly intense athletic and competitive academic environment where student athletes can reach their fullest potential! For more information on tryouts, please contact Coach Jessica Moss.

Physicals and RankOne Online Athletic paperwork MUST be completed in order to tryout. There are a total of 7 tabs to complete. Go to website: www.rankonesport.com

Click on tab for filling out electronic forms (upper right hand corner)

Select the state: Texas

Scroll down to Garland ISD

Click on tab for electronic participation forms

Start on Acknowledgement of Rules

Volleyball season officially starts August 1 and runs through October.

When planning family vacations and appointments, please be aware that we will begin August 1, which is before school starts. We expect all athletes to be at every practice, game, team activity, etc.

Games will be on Tuesday and Friday evenings. Tournaments are Friday-Saturday throughout August and September. Please plan accordingly.

We also encourage our athletes to participate in other school sports, in addition to volleyball. We always work out conflicts so do not feel pressured to choose one sport.
